content:
It's always helpful to be aware of local dining customs and etiquette when traveling to a new place, and Yunnan is no exception. Here are some things to keep in mind when dining at a Yunnan restaurant:

1. Don't finish all the food on your plate: Leaving a bit of food on your plate at the end of a meal is a sign of politeness and appreciation for the meal. 2. Use chopsticks: Yunnan cuisine is primarily eaten with chopsticks, so it's important to brush up on your chopstick skills before your trip. 3. Share dishes: In Yunnan dining culture, it's common to share dishes family-style, rather than ordering individual portions. So, it’s polite to wait for everyone to be served before starting to eat. 4. Drink tea: Yunnan is famous for its tea culture, and it is customary to drink tea before and after meals. 5. Show appreciation: Show your appreciation for your host by thanking them and complimenting their food. Overall, dining in Yunnan is a social and communal experience, emphasizing the importance of sharing, respect and appreciation of local culinary traditions. By keeping these customs and etiquettes in mind, you can enjoy your meal and connect with the local culture at the same time.
